@niketanpansare thank you for the suggestions. Root cause 32bit windows (Now fixed and changed to 64bit version). Currently I have other problems like the one below:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4648995/26607435/7652e622-4564-11e7-953e-bcd750438884.png)
spark-submit / spark-shell does not work on windows.

- I have configured JAVA_HOME, SPARK_HOME, HADOOP_HOME, SYSTEMML_HOME
- HADOOP_HOME contains `winutils`

Any thoughts / suggestions?.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://sparktc.ibmcloud.com/jenkins/job/SystemML-PullRequestBuilder/1524/

I took a quick look. Barring some minor comments (see below), it looked good to me. However, I still see `write` statements within `if` blocks. If this is what bothered MLContext, I'm wondering if the commit is good enough to work with MLContext?

Minor comments:

- there seems to be a few extra spaces before 'TYPE' in the header which shifted the 'TYPE' col
- can we turn `write_beta` into a boolean?
- in the example invocation, `write_beta` appears before `fmt` whereas in the header its the reverse. if possible, can we keep the order the same?

I took a quick look. Looks like we're setting up a `for` loop that pulls out each filter and applies them to the input `C/G` channels at a time.

Would this be another way to achieve the same thing: Generate a filter that has the appropriate `0`s to represent the grouped filter. This way, we don't have to run a `for` loop when we call the forward function.

Should be relatively easy to add a util function that takes a grouped filter and adds the requisite `0`s (`init_bilinear` in `nn/layers/conv2d_transpose.dml` does something like this).

It shows me an explain even when I haven't specified it:

```
➜  incubator-systemml git:(master) ✗ bin/systemml-spark-submit.py -f matmult.dml               
================================================================================
Output dir: /home/njindal/git/incubator-systemml/temp

17/06/05 11:30:27 WARN util.NativeCodeLoader: Unable to load native-hadoop library for your platform... using builtin-java classes where applicable
17/06/05 11:30:27 INFO api.DMLScript: EXPLAIN (RUNTIME):
# Memory Budget local/remote = 3186MB/?MB/?MB/?MB
# Degree of Parallelism (vcores) local/remote = 8/?
PROGRAM ( size CP/SP = 10/0 )
--MAIN PROGRAM
----GENERIC (lines 1-8) [recompile=false]
------CP createvar _mVar0 scratch_space//_p6710_127.0.1.1//_t0/temp0 true MATRIX binaryblock 1000 30000 1000 1000 30000000 copy
------CP rand 1000 30000 1000 1000 0.0 1.0 1.0 -1 uniform 1.0 8 _mVar0.MATRIX.DOUBLE
------CP createvar _mVar1 scratch_space//_p6710_127.0.1.1//_t0/temp1 true MATRIX binaryblock 30000 1000 1000 1000 30000000 copy
------CP rand 30000 1000 1000 1000 0.0 1.0 1.0 -1 uniform 1.0 8 _mVar1.MATRIX.DOUBLE
------CP createvar _mVar2 scratch_space//_p6710_127.0.1.1//_t0/temp2 true MATRIX binaryblock 1000 1000 1000 1000 -1 copy
------CP ba+* _mVar0.MATRIX.DOUBLE _mVar1.MATRIX.DOUBLE _mVar2.MATRIX.DOUBLE 8
------CP rmvar _mVar0
------CP rmvar _mVar1
------CP write _mVar2.MATRIX.DOUBLE Vout.SCALAR.STRING.true textcell.SCALAR.STRING.true .SCALAR.STRING.true
------CP rmvar _mVar2

SystemML Statistics:
Total elapsed time:		4.649 sec.

Total execution time:		4.065 sec.
Number of compiled Spark inst:	0.

Heavy hitter instructions:

@nakul02 I have made explain as an conditional input now. 

I had included explain as an default argument as per my observations [here](https://github.com/apache/incubator-systemml/blob/master/src/main/java/org/apache/sysml/api/DMLScript.java#L380)
@prithvirajsen Thank you for reviewing this. I've made changes as you suggested.

ping @nakul02, can I have another review?.
As per our earlier discussion, I have tested this script on the following platforms

- [x] OSX
- [x] Ubuntu
- [x] Windows

On windows, I tested this on `command prompt` and `Cygwin`. Known issue does not work in `Cygwin`.
I don't think Jenkins is running the tests for this PR.  I don't see one here: <https://sparktc.ibmcloud.com/jenkins/job/SystemML-PullRequestBuilder/>

Still a bunch of problems. I would recommend testing against `systemml-standalone.py`. This script should behave like that.

```
➜  incubator-systemml git:(gpu_nntest_fix) ✗ bin/systemml-spark-submit.py -f matmult.dml -explain
usage: systemml-spark-submit.py [--help] [--master] [--driver-memory]
                                [--num-executors] [--executor-memory]
                                [--executor-cores] [--conf  [...]]
                                [-nvargs NVARGS [NVARGS ...]] [-args  [...]]
                                [-config] [-exec] [-explain] [-debug]
                                [-stats STATS] -f
systemml-spark-submit.py: error: argument -explain: expected one argument
➜  incubator-systemml git:(gpu_nntest_fix) ✗ bin/systemml-spark-submit.py -f matmult.dml -stats  
usage: systemml-spark-submit.py [--help] [--master] [--driver-memory]
                                [--num-executors] [--executor-memory]
                                [--executor-cores] [--conf  [...]]
                                [-nvargs NVARGS [NVARGS ...]] [-args  [...]]
                                [-config] [-exec] [-explain] [-debug]
                                [-stats STATS] -f
systemml-spark-submit.py: error: argument -stats: expected one argument
➜  incubator-systemml git:(gpu_nntest_fix) ✗ bin/systemml-spark-submit.py --master 'local[5]' --conf spark.driver.extraJavaOptions="-Xmx15g"
usage: systemml-spark-submit.py [--help] [--master] [--driver-memory]
                                [--num-executors] [--executor-memory]
                                [--executor-cores] [--conf  [...]]
                                [-nvargs NVARGS [NVARGS ...]] [-args  [...]]
                                [-config] [-exec] [-explain] [-debug]
                                [-stats STATS] -f
systemml-spark-submit.py: error: argument -f is required

➜  incubator-systemml git:(gpu_nntest_fix) ✗ bin/systemml-spark-submit.py --master 'local[5]' --conf spark.driver.extraJavaOptions="-Xmx15g"
usage: systemml-spark-submit.py [--help] [--master] [--driver-memory]
                                [--num-executors] [--executor-memory]
                                [--executor-cores] [--conf  [...]]
                                [-nvargs NVARGS [NVARGS ...]] [-args  [...]]
                                [-config] [-exec] [-explain] [-debug]
                                [-stats STATS] -f
systemml-spark-submit.py: error: argument -f is required
```

`explain`, `stats`, `gpu` accept an optional parameter. Your script requires a parameter, which is not the expected behavior. The `--conf` parameter doesn't work.
@nakul02 Thanks for the review. I will use `systemml-standalone.py` to test against my script.
@p-janardhan Thanks for working on this!
Sure will do :)
Test this Jenkins

Hello @nakul02, `--conf` parameter was indeed not working.

What is the expected behaviour of this command below?
```
bin/systemml-spark-submit.py --master 'local[5]' --conf spark.driver.extraJavaOptions="-Xmx15g"
```
I was under the impression that this would fail anyway since the corresponding dml script is not provided. 

Second question:
Is this error message useful or should I just remove it and keep it simple?. 

```
usage: systemml-spark-submit.py [--help] [--master] [--driver-memory]
                                [--num-executors] [--executor-memory]
                                [--executor-cores] [--conf  [...]]
                                [-nvargs NVARGS [NVARGS ...]] [-args  [...]]
                                [-config] [-exec] [-explain] [-debug]
                                [-stats STATS] -f
```
Can an Admin verify this patch?

@nakul02 I have tested the following commands on my local system. Except the gpu flag everything works. I am not sure why I get `jcuda` error.

```
bin/systemml-spark-submit.py --master local[5] --conf spark.driver.maxResultSize="0" spark.akka.frameSize="128"  -f bin/matmul.dml
bin/systemml-spark-submit.py --master local[5]  -f bin/matmul.dml
bin/systemml-spark-submit.py --master local[5] -f bin/matmul.dml -explain
bin/systemml-spark-submit.py --master local[5] -f bin/matmul.dml -stats
bin/systemml-spark-submit.py --master local[5] -f bin/matmul.dml -gpu
```
Error trace when used with -gpu flag below
```

        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:483)
        at org.apache.spark.deploy.SparkSubmit$.org$apache$spark$deploy$SparkSubmit$$runMain(SparkSubmit.scala:738)
        at org.apache.spark.deploy.SparkSubmit$.doRunMain$1(SparkSubmit.scala:187)
        at org.apache.spark.deploy.SparkSubmit$.submit(SparkSubmit.scala:212)
        at org.apache.spark.deploy.SparkSubmit$.main(SparkSubmit.scala:126)
        at org.apache.spark.deploy.SparkSubmit.main(SparkSubmit.scala)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: jcuda.runtime.JCuda
        at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:372)
